{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3557235,"name":"Ryan zheng","username":"Rzheng1232","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rzheng1232/{size}/182897_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-14T19:57:53.155Z","cooked":"

Hey guys,
We have a REV through bore encoder and we used a 6 pin to 4 Channel PWM Cable to connect to the RoboRio. I tried using the edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Encoder class to initialize and get angle readings from the encoder, but the class only accepts 2 DIO channel inputs, even though the PWM cable I’m using has 4 DIO channels. So my question is, which 2 DIO channels would I specify when I initialize the encoder?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-14T19:57:53.155Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":44,"readers_count":43,"score":33.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":495593,"topic_slug":"throughbore-encoder-programming-question","display_username":"Ryan zheng","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-1817/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"JST PH 6-pin to 4 Channel PWM Cable - 1m - REV Robotics","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55168,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/throughbore-encoder-programming-question/495593/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3557236,"name":"","username":"CarbonSmasher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/carbonsmasher/{size}/255012_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-14T19:59:56.003Z","cooked":"

Depends on whether you want to use it for absolute or relative readings. For the relative / quadrature mode, you need two cables connected

Here’s the link to the data sheet which shows which cables are which

revrobotics.com

REV-11-1271-DS.pdf

250.41 KB

Sorry, I’m unfamiliar with a lot of the electrical side of things, but if I wanted to retrieve the absolute encoder reading, which port would I need. Just the ABS? What about the relative reading, would I use ENC A, ENC B, and/or ENC I? Thanks!

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-14T20:07:39.039Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":26,"readers_count":25,"score":5.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495593,"topic_slug":"throughbore-encoder-programming-question","display_username":"Ryan zheng","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":62692,"username":"CarbonSmasher","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/carbonsmasher/{size}/255012_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55168,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/throughbore-encoder-programming-question/495593/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3557244,"name":"","username":"CarbonSmasher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/carbonsmasher/{size}/255012_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-14T20:09:09.237Z","cooked":"

For absolute, you would just need to connect the white wire, power, and ground to one of the DIO ports on the RIO.

For relative, you do the same thing but with the yellow and blue cables in two DIO slots
